subject: Return 404 for images in pending_delete status

values.-1: This patch needs further work before it can be merged
values.+1: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1

Not sure if we want to rely on the deleted attribute, but it seems to pass tests so, it looks good to me.

Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1

This looks like a good approach.

I'm not sure if there was some original use case to return a 403 instead of 404. So, let's confirm with some other folks on this.

Adding them to the reviewers list.

Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1

I can't think of a good reason to send a 403 for pending_delete. As far as the consumer of the Glance API is concerned, the image should be considered deleted. It simply hasn't been garbage collected yet.
Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1
Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1

Patch Set 1:

I'm just throwing this out there.  There was talk at some point about allowing an admin to un-delete an image in pending_delete status.  I don't remember whatever happened to that discussion.  If admin-un-delete is not a use case we want to support, then I agree that the 404 makes the most sense.

Patch Set 1:

I don't have a knowledge on the history but it certainly throws up an interesting perspective. Even though, the V2 apis seem to use this 'state' key to return a 404 at the moment.

Patch Set 1:

From the perspective of the Scrubber being a garbage collector and pending_delete meaning marked for garbage collection, I think it'd be a bad idea to support un-delete. Right now pending_delete is really just a way to switch between synchronous deletes and garbage collection.
Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1
Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1
Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1

Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

I don't think it makes any sense to change this in v1 which is hopefully deprecated finally on Liberty cycle. We have avoided making any non-serious changes to v1 and it's not entirely wrong to return forbidden here either. I do agree that we definitely should not start implementing recovery for v1 at this stage, but this does not look worth of changing either with the risk of breaking something down the line.
Uploaded patch set 2.

Patch Set 2:

I have added the docimpact and the apiimpact flags, as was discussed during one of the glance meetings.

Let me know if this is good or we need to abandon the patchset.

Patch Set 2: Code-Review-2

Hi Sudipta,

First and foremost, thanks a lot for working on this. I'm -2'ing this patch because the change, regardless on whether we use the APIImpact flag or not, is a breaking change and it, at the very least, requires a version bump.

As you probably know, we've been very reluctant to keep changing v1 at all. We've done some exceptions for fixes that seemed simple and that didn't change the API itself. Unfortunately, this is not one of those.

I'd prefer not to merge this patch because  of the above.

Patch Set 2: Verified+1
